chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Shelly J Greeson was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 66 days sentence credit.

superMiscConds.notes: DNA surcharge and Blood draw costs are to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.  Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for City of New Berlin Police Department.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Ignition Interlock Device installed for the period of Extended Supervision.
Not to drive or operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.

Fine is to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Shelly J Greeson in court, in custody, with attorney Katie B. Bricco.   

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 1.
Count 2 is dismissed as a read in.
Count 3 is dismissed by operation of law.
Defendant presented statements to the court.



Court orders the following:
Total Prison:  8 Years.
Initial Confinement:  3 Years.
Extended Supervision:  5 Years.
66 Days Credit

5 Years D/L REVOCATION
5 Years IGNITION INTERLOCK

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
Ignition Interlock Device installed for the period of extended supervision.  
Do not drive or operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.
DNA sample to be provided.

Fine:  $6,899
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff's Department.
BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35 (to be forward to City of New Berlin Police Department);
To be paid as a Condition of the Sentence (can be taken out of prison wages/trust accounts).

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

Defendant to be transferre to Taycheedah - FORTHWITH.
documents regarding defendant's schooling and several character reference letters filed.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 03-01-2016 11:00 am

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Katrina Seipel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Katie B. Bricco in court, defendant Shelly J Greeson not in court, in custody.   
Atty. Bricco waives her client's appearance.
File not called on the record.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 1, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Hearing at 02-05-2016 01:30 pm
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Shelly J Greeson in court, in custody, with attorney Katie B. Bricco.   Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for February 5, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing at 01-13-2016 03:00 pm

Defendant Shelly J Greeson in court with attorney Cameron Weitzner.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.   Preliminary Hearing requested within 10 days  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 13, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Shelly J Greeson
Current: 515 West Moreland Blvd, C/O Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 01-04-2016)
Prior: 13445 W Armour Ave, New Berlin, WI 53151

Defendant Shelly J Greeson in court, in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant needs additional time to obtain counsel and requests a modification of bail amount.  State objects to a modification of bail.  The Court denied the Motion to Modify Bail.   Bail remains as fixed.    Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Defendant to be re-evaluated by the public defender.  Hearing scheduled for January 5, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.   Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.   Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant to pay costs associated with SCRAM monitoring.  Defendants who can not pay will be required to follow an enhanced level of direct supervision requirements as established by WCS.  WCS will notify the Court.  Defendant to be released directly/only to Wisconsin Community Services personnel to set-up SCRAM monitoring.

Defendant Shelly J Greeson in court, in custody, with attorney Kelsey Morin.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears as friend of the court.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Court provides appointment of counsel papers to the defendant.   Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Hearing scheduled for December 30, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
